meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rancid.
meanings.sent1: The rancidness of the old butter made it inedible.
meanings.sent2: The rancidness of the meat indicated it was spoiled.
meanings.sent3: The rancidness of the cheese was so strong, it could walk out of the fridge on its own!
meanings.sent4: The rancidness of the oil seeped into every corner of the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The rancidness of the milk hit me as soon as I opened the carton.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a rank, unpleasant smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The rancidness of the garbage bin made me gag.
meanings.sent2: The rancidness of the fish market was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The rancidness of the socks left under the bed was like a stinky surprise.
meanings.sent4: The rancidness of the air in the alley clung to my clothes.
meanings.sent5: The rancidness of the dumpster behind the restaurant was unbearable.
